data.text:
GENERAL DIRECTOR

Dr. Hassan Jabareen, Advocate | Founder of Adalah and General Director

Hassan is the founder of Adalah. He has served as Adalah’s general and legal director since its establishment in 1996. He holds an LLB in Law and a BA in Philosophy from Tel Aviv University, an LLM in International Human Rights from American University Washington College of Law, and a PhD in Law from Hebrew University. Over the last 30 years, he has litigated scores of landmark constitutional law cases regarding Palestinian citizens of Israel, including the Palestinian leadership in Israel, and international humanitarian law cases concerning Palestinians in the 1967 Occupied Territory before the Israeli Supreme Court. Also, since 1998, he has been an adjunct lecturer for a course that he initiated on the legal status of the Arab minority in Israel and other law courses in the Faculties of Law at Tel Aviv, Hebrew, and Haifa Universities. He has received several awards for outstanding public interest lawyering and top human rights law prizes. He has also published several academic articles in edited books and law reviews on the citizenship status of the Palestinians. Hassan was a Yale World Fellow; a Senior Robina Law Fellow at Yale Law School; a research fellow at the Wissenschaftskolleg in Berlin; and a visiting scholar at Columbia University Law School.

Follow me on Academia.edu

Rabea Eghbariah | Affiliated Attorney

Rabea Eghbariah is an attorney completing his doctoral studies at Harvard Law School. He worked as an appellate public defender before joining Adalah, where he continues to work over summers. Rabea argued major civil and political rights cases and published on various subjects relating to Palestinians and Israeli law. His writings appeared in the Yale Journal of Law and Technology, the Law and Political Economy Project, and the Journal of Palestine Studies, among others. Rabea previously served as an executive article editor of the Harvard Human Rights Journal and currently serves as an editorial member of Jadaliyya's Palestine page.

Fady Khoury, Advocate | Civil and Political Rights Unit

LAND AND PLANNING RIGHTS UNIT

Nareman Shehadeh-Zoabi, Advocate | Economic and Social Rights Unit

Nareman holds a LLB in Law and BA in Psychology from Hebrew University in Jerusalem (2014). During her academic studies, Nareman participated in the "Street Law" program; volunteered at the Israel National Council for the Child and at the Rape Crisis and Sexual Assault Center. Nareman worked as an Arabic-language translator in the Jerusalem court system, and as a tour guide on behalf of the Center for Civics and Democracy Studies at the Israeli Supreme Court and the Knesset. Nareman completed her legal internship in the Haifa district criminal prosecutor's office and subsequently worked in the private sector. Nareman joined Adalah in 2018.

Salam Irsheid, Advocate | Economic and Social Rights Unit

Salam holds an LLB in Law from Bar-Ilan University, and a BA in Communication and Journalism with a minor in English from the Hebrew University. During her law studies, Salam served as a staff editor for the journal of “Law, Religion and State” (2018); in the Hebrew Research Network (2019), she worked as a research assistant in the field of international law; and she participated in a legal clinic at the Justice Ministry’s legislation and legal advice office in the field of international trade law. Salam completed her legal internship in a private law firm dealing with labor, trade and real estate. After receiving her license in 2021, Salam joined Adalah.

LEGAL APPRENTICE & LAW STUDENTS

Ola Taha | Legal Apprentice

Ola holds an LLB in Law from the Faculty of Law, Tel Aviv University, and is a second-year student in Sociology and Anthropology. During her law studies, Ola served as a staff editor for the journal: "Law, Society and Culture", participated in a Human Rights Clinic (theoretical and practical work), and volunteered in a variety of civil society organizations. Ola joined Adalah in 2021 as a law student researcher, and in March 2022, she will begin her legal apprenticeship.

Mohammad Awad | Legal Apprentice

Mohammad holds an LLB in Law from the Faculty of Law, Tel Aviv University, and is a third-year student in political science. During his studies, Mohammad participated in a Human Rights Clinic, worked in a student position in a law firm specializing in human rights and volunteered in several civil society organizations. Mohammad joined Adalah in 2022 as a legal apprentice, and also works as an instructor at the Tamra School for Gifted Children.

Mai Diab | Legal Apprentice

Mai holds an LLB in Law and a Bachelor's Degree in German Language and Literature from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. During her studies, she served as a Research Assistant and Teaching Assistant. Additionally, Mai served as an Editor at the Israel Law Review Legal Journal of the Law Faculty of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem and Cambridge University. She also participated in the International Human Rights Law clinic, took part in the UN World Model Conference in Jerusalem, and won the award for the best representative. Mai also worked as an Administrative Assistant at Teach for Bolivia NGO and provided administrative support and researched grants at Just Action NG. Additionally, she volunteered as an Interpreter for I Have Rights NGO, offering interpretation services during legal counseling sessions and workshops for asylum seekers. Mai joined Adalah in 2022 as a legal apprentice.

Majd Haddad | Law Student Researcher

Majd is a third-year law student in the Faculty of Law, Tel Aviv University. Alongside his studies, Majd serves as an editor for the Tel Aviv University Law Review (Iyunei Mishpat), participated in the Criminal Justice Clinic and served as a research assistant in the fields of law and language and law and COVID-19. Majd is also an active member of “Almuntada” – Arab Law Students Forum. Majd joined Adalah in 2021 as a law student researcher.

INTERNATIONAL ADVOCACY & RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT

Rina Rosenberg (Jabareen), Esq. | Co-Founder of Adalah and International Advocacy and Resource Development Director

Rina is a lawyer and a co-founder of Adalah. She is a member of the New York Bar. She has a BA in History from New York University (USA) and a Juris Doctor and LLM in Criminal Law from Georgetown University Law Center in Washington, DC (USA). She also completed numerous classes in the MA Program in Holocaust Studies at Haifa University. Her work with Adalah includes research and advocacy before UN, EU and US bodies; extensive fundraising, donor relations, and financial management; outreach to the international media; writing and editing publications; and institutional development projects. Previously, she worked on resource development and international human rights advocacy with the Arab Association for Human Rights (HRA), the Galilee Society, and the Working Group on the Status of Palestinian Women in Israel. Prior to working in Israel, she worked as a public defender in NYC and as a clinical supervisor for law students with the Criminal Justice Clinic of Georgetown University Law Center in DC (USA). Rina was a Schell Fellow at Yale Law School in 2005-2006 and 2012-2014, and a visiting scholar at Columbia University Law School.

Katie Hesketh | Senior International Advocacy and Resource Development Associate

Katie has worked for Adalah since 2008. Previously, she worked as a Public Policy Unit Assistant at the Catholic Agency for Overseas Development (CAFOD). She received an MSc in International Relations from the London School Economic and Political Science (2002) and a B.A. in Arabic and Middle Eastern and Islamic Studies from Durham University.

Ranna Khalil | Researcher and Resource Development Associate

Before joining Adalah in February 2020, Ranna worked for years as a TV news producer for international media outlets, including NBC News and the Associated Press TV News, reporting on current Israeli and Palestinian affairs, and for a year in Berlin, as a planning producer for an international video news agency, covering worldwide news with a focus on the MENA region. She has also worked with local human rights organizations. She received two fellowships: one for journalism from the Herbert Quandt-Stiftung within the framework of the Trialog der Kulturen to work in Germany, and the other from Minerva Center for Human Rights at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. Ranna received a B.A in Communications and Journalism and English, and an M.A in Communications and Journalism from the Hebrew University.

Asala Mansour | International Advocacy Associate

Asala holds an L.L.B in Law with a minor in English Literature from Birzeit University. During her studies, Asala participated in two international law moot court competitions, one hosted by the ICRC and the other by Oxford University, where her team won first place in the regional rounds and she won Best Oralist overall and Best Oralist in the final round. Asala also joined the Right to Education campaign, and completed a legal training with Addameer on Israeli military courts and participated in a social media campaign on this issue.

Lauren Blaxter | International Advocacy & Resource Development Associate

Lauren received an LLM in International Criminal Law (2016) and a Graduate Diploma in Law (2015) from the University of Sussex. She also holds a BA in Human Rights from Bard College (2013). Before joining Adalah, Lauren worked for various NGOs in research, advocacy, and resource development. Lauren has also worked in data collection and analysis related to armed conflict, particularly in the Israel/Palestine context. Lauren joined Adalah in 2023.

COMMUNICATIONS DEPARTMENT

Ari Remez | Hebrew Communications Coordinator

Ari Remez joined Adalah’s comms team in November 2018, leading our press relations in Hebrew. Ari has published dozens of articles and op-eds in various media platforms on a wide range of political issues. He has a background in political activism, as well as experience as the media and campaign coordinator for “Shutafut-Sharakah”, a coalition of civil society organizations for a shared and equal society in Israel. Ari is also Just Vision's Outreach Associate in Israel, where he oversees screenings and programming related to documentary film, “Naila and the Uprising”.

Lama Taha | Arabic Communications Coordinator

Lama holds a Bachelor's degree in Media and English Literature from the University of Haifa. She previously worked as a producer, researcher for news, political, and cultural television programs at i24NEWS, an Arabic-language channel. Lama specialized in covering Israeli and Palestinian affairs. Additionally, she has also worked at and volunteered with several local human rights organizations. Lama joined Adalah in June 2023 as the Arabic Communications Coordinator.

Miriam Azem | International Advocacy and Communications Associate

Miriam holds an LLB in International and European Law from the University of Groningen, Netherlands. Throughout her studies, Miriam completed an interdisciplinary honours program and conducted research in the field of the rule of law. Alongside her studies, Miriam was also an active member of the Amnesty International student group. Miriam joined Adalah in 2021.

FINANCE AND ADMINSTRATION

Ghada Abboud | Administrative Assistant

Ghada has extensive experience in marketing and managing her own company, managing employees, and sales. She also has years of experience in accounting management in private companies and an accounting firm. Ghada has taken management courses and specialized courses in administrative support for the legal and medical fields. Ghada joined Adalah in January 2023 as an administrative assistant.

Ghassan Kharouba | Finance Director

Ghassan received a B.A. in Accounting and Economics from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. and has worked with Adalah since 2008. Ghassan is a Certified Public Accountant and has run a private accounting business since 1994. He has extensive experience auditing financial reports for public institutions and providing financial consulting to NGOs. In addition to working at Adalah, he is a founding member of the Hewar Association for Alternative Education, in which he has served as a board member and chairperson of the financial committee since its establishment in 2001.
